keyMoments.title: Sabo's Ship Destroyed by Celestial Dragon
keyMoments.description: Sabo's small fishing boat is destroyed by Saint Jalmack's bazooka attack as it passes the Celestial Dragon's ship, apparently killing Sabo.
keyMoments.significance: Sabo's apparent death traumatizes Ace and Luffy and demonstrates the cruelty and absolute power of the Celestial Dragons. This event shapes both brothers' understanding of the world's injustice.

keyMoments.title: Sabo's Final Letter Delivered
keyMoments.description: Sabo's letter, written before he set out to sea, is delivered to Ace. In it, he asks Ace to take care of Luffy and watch over their younger brother.
keyMoments.significance: The letter serves as Sabo's final testament and binds Ace to his promise to protect Luffy. It demonstrates Sabo's enduring love for his brothers and becomes a driving force in Ace's future actions.
keyMoments.quote: Take care of Luffy for me.

relationships.description: Sabo's final letter to Ace asks him to take care of Luffy, cementing their brotherly bond even in death.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo's final letter reveals the depth of his trust in Ace and his love for both brothers.

relationships.description: Sabo asks Ace to take care of Luffy, showing his protective love for his youngest brother.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo's letter expresses his concern for Luffy's future and his wish for Ace to protect him.

reveals.information: Sabo's ship is destroyed by a Celestial Dragon, apparently killing him
Sabo wrote a final letter asking Ace to take care of Luffy before setting out to sea

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace Returns from Gray Terminal
keyMoments.description: Ace returns to the mountain bandit hideout with Dadan after surviving the Gray Terminal fire and defeating Bluejam.
keyMoments.significance: Ace's safe return provides temporary relief before the devastating news of Sabo's death arrives.

keyMoments.title: Ace's Rage and Attempted Revenge
keyMoments.description: Consumed by grief and rage, Ace attacks Dogra and tries to kill the Celestial Dragon responsible for Sabo's death. Dadan restrains him to prevent his suicide mission.
keyMoments.significance: This moment reveals Ace's intense protective nature toward his brothers and his willingness to sacrifice himself for vengeance.
keyMoments.quote: I'm going to kill that Celestial Dragon!

keyMoments.title: Ace Receives Sabo's Final Letter
keyMoments.description: Ace receives Sabo's letter asking him to take care of Luffy. Upon reading it, he breaks down in tears, finally allowing himself to grieve.
keyMoments.significance: The letter binds Ace to his promise to protect Luffy and profoundly impacts his future actions and relationship with his younger brother.

keyMoments.title: Ace Consoles Luffy About Living Freely
keyMoments.description: Ace consoles Luffy and tells him they must live without regrets, honoring Sabo's memory by pursuing their dreams and living freely.
keyMoments.significance: This establishes Ace's resolve to live freely and protect Luffy, which becomes his core motivation throughout the series.
keyMoments.quote: We have to live without regrets, Luffy. That's something Sabo couldn't do.

relationships.description: Ace receives Sabo's final letter asking him to take care of Luffy, which becomes a sacred promise.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo's death and letter deepen Ace's sense of responsibility and grief, making him take on the role of sole protector of Luffy.

relationships.description: Ace takes on the responsibility to protect and guide Luffy, as requested in Sabo's final letter.

evolutionMoments.description: After Sabo's death, Ace fully commits to protecting Luffy and encouraging him to live freely without regrets.

relationships.description: Dadan risks her life running through the Gray Terminal fire to save Ace, demonstrating her maternal love despite her tough exterior.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan's severe burns from saving Ace and her physical restraint to prevent his suicide mission show the depth of her care for him.

reveals.information: Ace is willing to sacrifice himself to avenge Sabo, showing his intense loyalty to his brothers
Ace accepts Sabo's dying wish to take care of Luffy, making it his life's mission

keyMoments.title: Luffy Learns of Sabo's Death
keyMoments.description: Luffy learns that Sabo's ship was destroyed by a Celestial Dragon and he is presumed dead. Unable to comprehend the loss, Luffy breaks down in tears.
keyMoments.significance: Sabo's death becomes one of Luffy's defining childhood traumas, teaching him about the world's cruelty and the importance of protecting those he loves.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Learns to Live Without Regrets
keyMoments.description: Through Ace's consolation, Luffy begins to understand the importance of living freely without regrets, which becomes a core part of his character.
keyMoments.significance: This lesson from Ace shapes Luffy's philosophy and approach to life throughout the series.

relationships.description: Luffy grieves deeply for Sabo's apparent death and is comforted by Ace.

evolutionMoments.description: Sabo's death devastates Luffy, marking a profound loss that shapes his understanding of mortality and loss.

relationships.description: Ace takes on the role of Luffy's protector and guide after Sabo's death, consoling him and teaching him to live without regrets.

evolutionMoments.description: After Sabo's death, Ace becomes Luffy's primary source of strength and guidance, deepening their brotherly bond.

keyMoments.title: Dadan Returns with Severe Burns
keyMoments.description: Dadan returns from the Gray Terminal fire with severe burns after running through the flames to create an escape path for herself and Ace.
keyMoments.significance: Dadan's injuries demonstrate her deep maternal love for Ace despite her tough bandit exterior and willingness to sacrifice herself for the boys.

keyMoments.title: Dadan Restrains Ace from Suicide Mission
keyMoments.description: Dadan and the bandits physically restrain Ace and tie him to a tree to prevent him from attempting to kill the Celestial Dragon responsible for Sabo's death.
keyMoments.significance: Dadan saves Ace's life by preventing his suicidal revenge attempt, showing her protective maternal instincts.

relationships.description: Dadan acts as Ace's mother figure, risking her life to save him from the Gray Terminal fire and preventing his suicide mission.

evolutionMoments.description: Dadan's severe burns and her physical restraint of Ace demonstrate the depth of her maternal love and willingness to sacrifice for him.

relationships.description: Dadan serves as Luffy's guardian and mother figure, protecting him and caring for him.

reveals.information: Dadan is willing to run through fire and sustain severe burns to protect Ace

keyMoments.title: Dogra Brings News of Sabo's Death
keyMoments.description: Dogra returns from town with the devastating news that Sabo's ship was destroyed by a Celestial Dragon and he is presumed dead.
keyMoments.significance: Dogra delivers the life-changing news that triggers Ace's rage and grief, serving as the messenger of tragedy.
keyMoments.quote: Sabo's ship... it was destroyed by a Celestial Dragon.

keyMoments.title: Saint Jalmack Destroys Sabo's Ship
keyMoments.description: Saint Jalmack fires a bazooka at Sabo's small fishing boat as it passes his ship, destroying it and apparently killing Sabo.
keyMoments.significance: This act demonstrates the absolute power and casual cruelty of the Celestial Dragons, becoming a catalyst for Ace and Luffy's understanding of the world's injustice.

reveals.information: Saint Jalmack is cruel and self-centered, willing to kill anyone who offends him, including children
As a World Noble, Saint Jalmack has the authority to summon Admirals to eliminate anyone he considers offensive
